text:
When an sample under the transaction controller has an error 100%, the error 
percentage field in the transaction controller label row in Aggregate Report 
does not show any error percentage.( it shows 0.0% as if all the samples under 
it are successful).
creator: ganesh.giridhar@gmail.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
The Transaction Controller generates a dummy sample that totals the time it 
took to run all its children - this is documented in the component reference.

creator: ganesh.giridhar@gmail.com
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> The Transaction Controller generates a dummy sample that totals the time it 
> took to run all its children - this is documented in the component reference.


I have a requirement such that if any children of transaction controller has 
error percentage, then the dummy sample that Transaction controller generates 
must also show the error percentage( as error percentage/no.of child samples 
under it). As of now its showing 0%.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text: In that case it is not a bug, it is an enhancement.

creator: ganesh.giridhar@gmail.com
text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> In that case it is not a bug, it is an enhancement.

OK. Can anyone suggest how to achieve the mentioned requirement.

creator: alf@i100.no
text:
I think this bug can maybe be closed as "fixed". The Aggregate Report will now
show the percentage of transaction samples that failed.
I see that this is not exactly what this enhancement is asking for, but I do not
see how a transaction sample can report how many of its' subsamples that failed.
